newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates close firmer, but trend limited.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates close firmer, but trend limited.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates ended firmer on Tuesday, but the central bank's vow to keep the short-term interest rates between 5.0 and 5.5 percent slowed the uptrend, dealers said.
The overnight interbank rate finished at 5.430 percent against Monday's 5.407 close, with 30-day commercial paper up to 5.25 percent against 5.15-20.
Dealers expected liquidity to remain tight ahead of the lunar New Year holiday, which begins on February 7 this year.
The bond market was sluggish in the afternoon. The 10-year 86/4 bond yield was at 6.135 earlier.
